blocks.content:
# Welcome to the Dynatrace Site Reliability Engineers Onboarding Launchpad
This Launchpad is designed to empower Site Reliability Engineers such as yourself with everything needed to excel in day to day operations. It offers guided access to documentation, best practices, and tutorial videos that support in resolving incidents, optimising systems, or improving service resilience and more.
### Explore our Dynatrace University courses and YouTube playlists to help you getting started

content.title: Introduction to Automation
content.description: This beginner-friendly course introduces the fundamentals of Dynatrace Automations and SLOs

content.title: Introduction to Dynatrace AI Engine
content.description: This playlist provides an overview on baselining, problem detection sensitivity and root cause analysis.

content.title: Application Observability
content.description: This introductory course provides insight into service and application monitoring.

content.title: Define the Right SLO Thresholds
content.description: Struggling to define the right thresholds for your SLO's? Watch now to learn actionable tips and tricks to improve your SLO strategy!

content.title: Introduction to Anomaly Detection based on DQL
content.description: Leverage anomaly detection to reduce alert noise and avoid alert fatigue.

blocks.content: ### Explore sample use cases via our Dynatrace Blog posts

content.title: Dynatrace AI predicts SLO violations and pinpoints root causes proactively
content.description: Learn how Dynatrace pinpoints the root causes of problems and their impacts on SLOs.

content.title: Accelerate and empower Site Reliability Engineering with Dynatrace observability
content.description: Explore how organisations can connect Dynatrace to their release processes and leverage Davis® AI to attain full automation.

content.title: Empowering SREs with runtime vulnerability analytics and security posture management
content.description: Secure production without slowing releases using Dynatrace for real-time vulnerability and compliance visibility.

blocks.content:
### Documentation
--- 
 
Access Dynatrace documentation for SLOs, Site Reliability Guardian, and Security Posture Management, plus best practices on leveraging threat observability to unify security data—helping SREs maintain uptime, compliance, and speed.
#### [Performance and Reliability monitoring]
Performance and reliability monitoring are critical for SRE teams to ensure systems consistently meet user expectations and maintain stability under varying conditions. Dynatrace enables these best practices by delivering insights that help teams proactively uphold service quality and prevent disruptions before they impact customers.
  * [Service Level Objectives Overview](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/slo-overview)
    * SLOs are essential for aligning reliability goals with business priorities, ensuring teams focus on measurable outcomes rather than arbitrary targets. Dynatrace helps enforce these best practices by providing clarity and accountability, enabling proactive decisions to maintain agreed service levels.
  * [Site Reliability Guardian](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/application-protection)
    * A site reliability guardian approach ensures continuous oversight of system health, reducing risk by embedding reliability checks into workflows. Dynatrace supports this mindset by enabling automated governance that keeps reliability at the forefront of operational decisions.
  * [Workflows](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/spm-hub)
    * Strong security posture management is critical to protect systems from vulnerabilities while maintaining operational resilience. Dynatrace contributes to this discipline by offering visibility that empowers teams to proactively mitigate risks and uphold compliance standards.
    
#### [Automation and Capacity planning]
Automation and capacity planning are essential for SRE teams to minimise manual intervention, reduce human error, and ensure systems scale reliably under unpredictable demand. Dynatrace supports these best practices by providing actionable insights that help teams proactively optimise resources and maintain resilience without constant firefighting.
* [Monaco](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/configuration-as-code-monaco)
  * Monaco was designed within Dynatrace to allow configuring Dynatrace environments at scale and in a reliable and secure way. It represents a lightweight CLI tool that uses native JSON to describe Dynatrace configuration resources.
* [Workflows](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/workflows)
  * By using a no-code/low-code, visual interface, organizations can automate repetitive tasks like problem remediation, security responses, and alerting, ensuring consistency and improving efficiency.  
* [AI in Workflows - Predictive Maintenance of Cloud Disks](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/davis-workflow-integration)
  * Workflow AI is vital tool as it turns observability data into predictive insights, enabling organisations to anticipate and prevent outages days before they occur.
* [Predict and autoscale Kubernetes workloads](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/self-service-kubernetes-tutorial)
  * Are you struggling to keep up with the demands of dynamic Kubernetes environments? Manual scaling is not only time-consuming and reactive, but also prone to errors.
